loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fresh and dried fish. Gina is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase of materials like nails, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase of materials like nails, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up in a small town in Rwanda, and due to his strong academic record, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Israel chose Kepler because he wants to learn the skills necessary to become a successful entrepreneur.

Israel plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. He doesn't have precise plans for his life after graduating, but he hopes to hone his business skills by working on many projects outside of class.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Ablavi  Conforte

texts.fr: Veuve et mère d’un enfant, Ablavi est une femme habitant à Tokoin. Agée de 37 ans, Ablavi une revendeuse de chouchou qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des douzaines de chouchou, Ablavi nécessite ce prêt pour financer son approvisionnement en vue d’en tirer profit et venir en aide à ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Ablavi is a widow with one child. She lives in Tokoin. She is 37 years old. She sells hair bands, she stocks up four times each month at the market. She sells her goods from home and in the local area. To order dozens of hair bands, Ablavi needs this loan to pay for her stock so that she can make more profit and help pay for her child's education.

loans.use: To buy 08 dozen hair bands..

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en: Hannatu  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dankwaire Village. Hannatujoined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hannatuwill have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hannatu now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields.

loans.name: Rayito De Luna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RAYITO DE LUNA” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elizabeth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elizabeth es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia y con el poco capital con el que contaba.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “RAYITO DE LUNA” credit group is in its eighth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of Collpani Center. It is made up of eighth members and is led by a board of directors of which Elizabeth is the president. The businesses that the members of the credit group have are varied. Among them are selling food, selling vegetables, a neighborhood store, selling clothes, and transportation service.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-business women, including Elizabeth. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling clothes. She reports that she learned about this business on her own initiative several years ago and with what little capital she had.

The loan she will take out now will be to increase capital by buying clothes wholesale that she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto, to later sell in her sales space. This work allows her to generate recourses to support her family financially. She is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fertilizantes, venta de ropa, venta de semillas, licorería, servicio de internet. 

El crédito que sacarán beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su madrina que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chamarras,  lo aprendió hace varios años de sus padres y con los pocos ahorros que tenía decidió emprender este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de chamarras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
A.C. “PRIMAVERA” will start the sixth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. The group has eight members and is lead by a board of directors with Margarita as president. The communal association members have various businesses such as fertilizer sales, clothes sales, seed sales, liquor store and internet services.  

The loan will benefit the small business of which Margarita is a part. She has been part of Pro Mujer for the last three years. She joined after being invited by her god mother, who is a client of the institution. Margarita is currently in the business of selling ponchos. She learned it a few years ago from her parents, and with her little savings she decided to start her own business. 

She will take out the loan to increase her capital (to buy ponchos wholesale) which she will buy from the El Alto city merchants to be sold later in her store. This work allows her to earn money to financially support her family, since she is married and has four children. 
  
When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health area provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy ponchos wholesale

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is 45 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school. Gemalyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, coffee, noodles, spices, etc.

Gemalyn has been in this business for two years.

In the future Gemalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, coffee, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to boost her piggery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 41 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

Marites has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Afavo Maendeleo Group

texts.fr: Lucie est commerçante, trésorière de la banque communautaire «Afavo Maendeleo», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 34 ans, mère des 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans une gallérie de la ville depuis son jeune âge. Elle va s’approvisionner en sacs de farines de formant, huile de palme, riz et maïs. Ce sont ses parents qui l’avaient aidé pour commencer son activité. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Lucie is a saleswoman and treasurer of the Afavo Maendeleo community bank. She is an IMF Hekima client and married with five children who all attend school. She has been selling food products in a gallery in the town since she was young. She will stock up on sacks of wheat flour, palm oil, rice and corn. Her parents helped her set up her business. She would like to build a house and feed her children and send them to school. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support for non bankable businesspeople.

loans.use: To stock up on sacks of wheat flour, palm oil, rice and corn.

loans.name: Vida Y Poder Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIDA Y PODER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Benita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de vasos, venta de mantas, venta de verduras, venta de herramientas, venta de pantuflas, venta de ropa, venta de papa y chuño.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Benita es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de vasos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace cuatro años de una amiga quien le ayudo en su negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vasos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas del departamento de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las reuniones de pago que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “VIDA Y PODER” credit group will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the German Busch Center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Benita is the president. The businesses that the members of the credit group have are varied. Among them are selling glasses, selling blankets, selling vegetables, selling tools, selling slippers, selling clothes, and selling potatoes and chuño.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-business women, including Benita. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Right now she has a business selling glasses. She says that she learned this business four years ago from a friend who helped her in the business.

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying glasses wholesale, which she will acquire from wholesalers in the department of Oruro and later she will sell them in her sales space. The type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, because she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health and the payment meetings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy glasses wholesale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

Marites dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron rods and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is experienced farmer from Jrapi village of Shirak region. He lives with his wife and daughter. Arsen's son is a cook, and migrated to a neighbouring country, with the hope of finding a well paid job.
Arsen runs a farm where he keeps livestock - 8 calves, 3 cows, 16 sheep, 80 hens and 22 colonies of bees. Arsen also cultivates wheat and potatoes and sells the harvest locally.
Now, he asks this loan to purchase seven newborn piglets, forage and fuel for the farm to develop his agribusiness.

Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs creates a number of difficulties for people trying to develop their businesses in the Shirak region. Arsen's loan has been approved through the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, in order to help them to gain market access and earn a living.
Arsen hopes to receive lenders' support and enlarge his farm.

loans.use: to pay for seven newborn piglets, forage and fuel for his farm.

loans.name: Amapolas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAPOLAS” iniciarán el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Veronica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de dulces, servicio de transporte, venta de comida, venta de frutas, servicio de encuadernación de cuadernos y libros.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Veronica es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de encuadernación de libros y cuadernos; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace cinco años y lo aprendió de su esposo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material para la encuadernación por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente ofrecerá sus servicios en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y las reuniones de pago que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Amapolas communal bank will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II Regional center. It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors. Veronica is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and include selling clothes, selling vegetables, selling sweets, transportation service, selling food, selling fruit, and binding books and notebooks.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business owners where Veronica is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer by invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business binding books and notebooks. She says that she started this business five years ago, and she learned from her husband. The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy book binding materials wholesale). She will make her purchase from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. She will later offer her services at her sales space.

The way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially. She is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training and the payment meetings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy book binding materials wholesale.

loans.name: Koun's Group

texts.en: Koun’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Koun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bonthouean's Group

texts.en: Bonthouean’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Bonthouean makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Enesto

texts.pt: O senhor Ernesto é casado, vive com a esposa, quatro filhos e três ajudantes agricultores. É Agricultor dedicando –se a produção e venda de hortícolas, com o presente  empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção, chapas, cantoneira, ferros e pagar a mão de obra para o fabrico de portões principais da sua casa. Tem sonho de adquirir uma viatura para o escoamento da sua produção agrícola e comprar  uma motobomba para melhorar o sistema de regadio dos seus campos de produção. Tem como maior desafio pagar bem o empréstimo e ganhar mais confiança na Hluvuku
texts.en:
Ernesto is married. He lives with his wife and four children and three farm workers. He is a farmer specialized in green vegetables. He will use this loan to buy contruction materials such as metal sheets, drywall, iron rods and pay for manual labor to build the main fence of his home.
His dream is to buy a vehicle to transport his produce and buy a motor pump to improve the irrigation system in the fields. 
His biggest goal is to repay this loan and earn the trust of Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, drywall, iron rods and pay for manual labor to build a main fence of his home.

loans.name: Zamiq

texts.en:
Zamiq is 26 year old, married and father of 3 kid. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with family in the Bilasuvar region. He is a dairy farmer, who started keeping dairy cows 4 years ago with a small amount of capital. He is also a very socially oriented person and knows that nowadays people have become health-conscious and very caring about their family’s health.

Therefore Zamiq wants to take first step and he believes he can make different products (cheese, yoghurt) from his cow’s milk. In this way he would develop his business. So Zamiq needs some money to buy cows and sheep. Please help him to reach this aim

loans.use: to buy cows and sheep, so as to enlarge his milk supplies to be able to produce cheese and yoghurt.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt: O senhor Armando é casado, vive com a esposa e seis filhos. É militar, com o presente  empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção, cimento, arreia e chapas de zinco. Tem sonho de terminar a sua casa e mudar-se, pois, onde reside agora é uma casa arrendada.Tem como maior desafio trabalhar cada vez mais para poder alcançar seu sonho.
texts.en:
Armando is married. He lives with his wife and children. He is in the military and he wants to use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and sinc roofing sheets.
His dream is to finish his home and move in, as he's living in a house that he rents right now. His biggest goal is to work harder to be able to reach his dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and sinc roofing sheets

loans.name: Rosas De Vino Tinto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE VINO TINTO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paola es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de celulares, venta de fresco, tienda de barrio, servicio de transporte, venta de masitas, venta de verduras, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paola es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de celulares; da a conocer que este negocio lo inició hace varios años, de un familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de celulares por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz para posteriormente  comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos otorgados y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ROSAS DE VINO TINTO” credit group will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Juan Pablo II Center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Paola is the Treasurer. The businesses that the members of credit group have are varied. Among them are selling cell phones, selling beverages, a neighborhood store, transportation, selling masitas, selling vegetables and selling food.

The loan she will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Paola. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a part of the institution. At this time, she has a business selling cell phones, She says that she started this business several years ago, with a relative.

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying cell phones wholesale. She will acquire them from sellers in the city of La Paz to later sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, because she is married and her three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loans and the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cell phones wholesale.

loans.name: Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTIAGO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Isawara es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Isawara es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su comunidad. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de su mamá y con el poco capital con el que contaba decidió emprender este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Santiago communal bank will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Regional Center. It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors, Isawara is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and include selling food, selling clothes, selling vegetables, and selling cheese. The loan that they will take out will benefit small business owners where Isawara is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer through a huge promotion that the institution conducted in her community.

She currently has a business selling clothes. She says that she learned this business several years ago from her mother. Wit the small amount of capital that she had she decided to undertake this business. The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy clothes wholesale). She will make her purchases from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. She will later sell the clothes at her sales stand. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially. She is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answered that the likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 39 years old and married with four children. She lives in a rural community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She runs a food stall selling BBQ foods to the community to earn a living and has been doing this for six months.

Rose requested a loan to buy cooking utensils, raw foods and ingredients to assist her in the BBQ business she runs. She hopes to provide a better education for her children with the profits she makes in her business and also to help cover her family's weekly expenses.

Rose recently joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a rice warmer, container, dish, tongs, gas and also fish, sausage, and rice as cooking ingredients for her BBQ business.

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en:
Sandrine is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up with her five siblings in a rural area of northern Rwanda. Because of Sandrine's impressive academic credentials, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Sandrine plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. A natural team member, Sandrine hopes to take on various leadership roles at university, as well as refine her writing abilities. Her greatest hope is to be successful enough to provide her siblings with the financial support to also attend university.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Deniz

texts.en:
Deniz is 36 years old, married and a mother of two. Deniz has been designing and selling jewellery for 10 years. She first started this at home. She sold her jewellery to her neighbours but in time she received orders in bulk. She used her third loan to buy bulks of materials for her jewellery.

Deniz also outsources to local housewives some of the small jewellery work and helps them make their own money. She turned the upper floor of her house into a workshop. In the future she is planning to open a big workshop and will enable more women to have work opportunities.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Deniz Hanım 36 yaşında, evli ve iki çocuk annesi. Deniz Hanım 10 yıldır takı tasarımı ve satışı yapıyor. Bu işe önce evinde başlamış. Yaptığı takıları yakın çevresine satmış ve zaman içinde toplu sipariş almaya başlamış. MAYA'dan 3. kredisini kullanan Deniz Hanım kredileri ile toplu malzeme aldı. Ayrıca Deniz Hanım ev kadınlarına küçük takı işleri vererek onlarında para kazanmalarına destek oluyor. Evinin üst katını atölyeye çevirmiş gelecekte daha büyük bir atölye açmak ve daha çok kadına iş imkanı sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy materials in bulk for her jewellery making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, nails and zinc roofing sheets.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli, a single mother of three, lives in Goghovit village of Shirak region with her children. She is a hard working woman, involved on her family farm and raising her children alone. Nelli is mainly concerned in cattle breeding and dairy production. She currently keeps 12 calves, 6 cows, 45 sheep and 20 hens.

Nelli produces cheese and sour cream and sells it in nearby markets. She works day and night to manage her work in the household, and her children are her only support.

Nelli ask lenders to support her with this loan enabling her to purchase fertilizer, seeds, fuel for land cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs creates a number of difficulties for people trying to develop their businesses in the Shirak region.

Nelli's loan has been approved through the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, in order to help them to gain market access and earn a living. Please help this nice woman to develop her farm and earn income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, fuel for land cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 36 years old and married with two children who are in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of foods to sell.

Ailene has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Ailene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of foods to sell.

loans.name: Desielyn

texts.en:
Desielyn is 41 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school. Desielyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Desielyn has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Desielyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
Florife works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Florife has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Florife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up with her father in Rwanda's capital of Kigali. Due to her tremendous academic potential, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. Olive chose to attend Kepler because she wanted a program that would give her the skills to secure a job after graduation. 

Olive plans to study Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduation, she hopes to become a pharmacologist and develop treatments for diseases that are prevalent in her community.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Flor De Amores Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE AMORES” iniciarán el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sussy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de chamarras, venta de comida, venta de enaguas y servicio de transporte. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sussy es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras y abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank “FLOR DE AMORES” will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Senkata. The group consists of 8 members and is directed by an executive board of which Sussy is the president. The members have various businesses: selling milk, selling jackets, selling food, selling refreshments, providing transportation. The loan will benefit their respective small businesses.

Sussy is a member of this group and she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation in a massive promotion the institution did in her area. Today she has a food business. She learned this work several years ago by her own initiative. The loan she seeks will be to increase capital in order to buy vegetables and groceries at wholesale that she will acquire from wholesalers in El Alto city. She will then make and sell her food in her vendor space. This work permits her to generate income to support her family, as she is single and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groceries.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.pt: A senhora Matilde é casada vive com o marido, três filhos e uma sobrinha.  É Militar, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de contrução, cimento, areia, pedra e a ligação da rede eléctrica na sua residência. Tem sonho de terminar a sua obra e adquirir uma viatura para o uso pessoal. Tem como maior desafio terminar o ensino superior.
texts.en:
Matilde is married and she lives with her husband, three children and a niece. She is in the military and she wants to use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, stone and install the connection to the power grid to her residence.
Her dream is to finish the works and buy a car for personal use. Her biggest goal is to finish her college degree.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone and install the connection to the power grid to her residence

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Her name is Marilyn, aged 43, from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Eddie, a driver with whom she has four children. Her husband's salary is not enough to raise a family of five so this drove Marilyn to put up a small general store to adequately meet their daily household needs and more importantly to send her children to school.

Marilyn sells dry, packaged household goods and food items directly to consumers. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her friendly personality attracts more customers at her store. It means a lot to her since it helps fund her children's school requirements.

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a Php 20000 loan to refill her store with more canned goods, bread, biscuits, chips, oil, beverages and toiletries. She hopes for your positive response to assist her in her livelihood. She will be very grateful for your help.

Marilyn dreams to have a big grocery store someday and of course to see both her children finish College to allow them a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for canned goods, bread, biscuits, chips, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Lorilyn

texts.en:
Lorilyn works hard to support her family. Lorilyn is married and has a selling fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Lorilyn has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Lorilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Razelda

texts.en:
Razelda works hard to support her family. Razelda is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Razelda has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Razelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Gloria  Luz

texts.en:
Gloria is a 54 years-old married woman who lives in the municipality of Andes. She has 12 children, 3 boys and 9 girls, so her family is really big. This means a big responsibility, but at the same time she feels proud of her big family and thanks the life for giving her such good children. She owns a food selling business since 2005, what lets her support her entire family.

As she has many mouths to feed at home, she wants to improve her business, trying to get many more clients and making the place bigger, so she can give a better service. She asked for a loan so she can buy inputs like corn, rice, grains, meat, vegetables, pots, glasses and chairs.

Gloría’s big family lives in a house that isn’t not comfortable for them, so she dreams of buying a big house where they all can live safe and with a better quality of life. You can help this hard worker mother to accomplish all her dreams, a loan will get her a lot closer to that.

loans.use: buy inputs like corn, rice, grains, meat, vegetables, pots, glasses and chairs to enlarge her business

loans.name: Lilian Karina

texts.en:
Lilian is 28 years old and lives in the municipality of Tolu Viejo. She lives there with her partner and her little beautiful daughter, 5 years old and who has become in the motor of Lilian’s life. She owns a raising pigs business, something she started to improve her family’s life.

Although she’s just starting with her business, she wants it to grow and improve, so she desires to increase her clients and consequently her sales, so she has better incomes. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy pigs and to fix the pigsty so the production can be better.

Lilian has big dreams for her business, expecting it will become a big and recognized one, but she also has dreams for her family; right now she wants to improve the conditions of her house because they’re not the best. Help Gloria to achieve her goals, with this loan she can do so many things.

loans.use: buy pigs and to fix the pigsty, so the production can be better.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Gina has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Molina

texts.en:
Molina is 32 years old and married. She has four children, who are in school. Molina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Molina has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Molina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
O senhor Carlos  de 49 anos de idade   é trabalhador de uma empresa agrícola, casado pai de 4 filho a frequentar  o ensino primário, sustenta 02 irmãos que vivem com ele na casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar cimento, , pedra, areia, varões  para dar continuidade a construção de sua casa.
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, mobilar,  fazer uma loja na sua casa para vender produtos de 1a necessidade, e com os empréstimos anteriores iniciou a construção de sua casa  .
Tem como desafios financeiros e para supera-los tem  estado a trabalhar e conta também com ajuda de sua esposa que também e operaria agrícola e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as mesmas e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Carlos is 49 years old and he works for an agro company. He is married with 4 children who attend grade school and he supports 2 of his siblings who live with him in a house that he owns.
He will use this loan to buy cement, stone, sand and metal rods to continue building his home.
His dream is to finish the works and furnish the home and build a store where to sell basic products. He began building his home with his previous loans.
He has some financial difficulties, so he's been working to overcome them and with the help of his wife, who is also an agro factory worker he would like to ask for more loans until they reach their dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone, sand and metal rods.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.pt:
A  senhora Maimuna de 51 anos de idade   é  comerciante e mãe  solteira de 4 filhos dos quais 2 na sua responsabilidade e outros 02 já maiores de idade e nas sua casas sustenta também seus pais enviando,  vive em casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar arroz, carne, peixe, batata, cebola para confecionar refeições e vender.
O seu sonho é crescer no negócio e ter  um estabelecimento condigno para maior satisfação de seus clientes. 
Tem como desafios financeiros tem  estado a trabalhar para supera-los e conta também com ajuda de um dos filhos,  construir sua casa própria pois atualmente vive numa cedida.
texts.en:
Maimuna is 51 years old. She is a businesswoman and a single mother of 4 children, 2 of them still under her care. She also supports her parents by sending them money. She lives in a house that she owns.
She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, potatoes, onions to make means to sell.
Her dream is to grow her business and have a respectable establishment to better serve her customers. 
She struggles financially, but she's determined to work and succeed. She also has help from her older children and she will like in the future to be able to build a house and she living in a house that was given to her at the moment.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, potatoes, onions to make means to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is a vendor of dried fish, at the local market. She is making good sales from this business activity. She believes that having a larger inventory of dried fish will increase her income. Recently, she availed a loan with which to purchase additional dried fish for inventory.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish for inventory.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
The story of life of Leonor can be likened to the rags to riches drama. She started with nothing, equipped with the knowledge of making fresh noodles. She borrowed an amount to start up her business and signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC and had availed the needed capital.

Leonor nowadays is making good sales and has increased demands that she asks for a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to purchase bags of flour, eggs and other ingredients for fresh noodles production. She is grateful that out from her savings, she is beginning to renovate her house and able to buy appliances for family use.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, eggs and other ingredients for fresh noodles production

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 61 years old. She is married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of household goods to sell.

Mila has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Melchie

texts.en:
Melchie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Melchie dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 31 years old. She has five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fish net and gasoline.

Yolanda has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fish net and gasoline.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is 52 years old and married with four children. She lives in a rural community on the outskirts of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She sews and selling clothing in the community or at the market to earn a living and has been doing this for two years.

Jemimah needs a loan to buy sewing materials and a new sewing machine to help assist her in the business. She plans to use her profit to help cover her family's daily expenses.

She recently joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy cloth material, cotton, elastic rubber and a sewing machine for her tailoring  business.

loans.name: Ubumwe Group

texts.en:
UBUMWE is a group led by Dative, who is 40 years old. The group name means “Unite” in English. Dative is married and has no children. She sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past 3 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives.

With this loan, Dative would like to buy more potatoes and rice for selling. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and rice for sale

loans.name: Zusette

texts.en:
Zusette is 42 years old and married with five children. With four of her children in school, Zusette works very hard to provide for them.

Zusette has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Zusette has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Zusette would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 48 years old and has three children. She is married, and two of her children are in school.

Felicitas is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Felicitas has been in this business for four years, and she has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for raising her livestock.

loans.name: Antonetta

texts.en:
Antonetta is 42 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Antonetta works very hard to provide for them.

Antonetta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Antonetta has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Antonetta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Quirino

texts.en:
Quirino is 65 years old. He is a widower with four adult age children and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is a retired government employee, and he is supported with his monthly pension.

Recently, he took a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase galvanized iron sheets, sticks, and nails, and to pay labor costs for his house repair.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized iron sheets, sticks, and nails, and pay labor costs for his house repair.

loans.name: Flor De Jhoselyn Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE JHOCELYN” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jhoselyn es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son: venta de abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de frutas, venta de artesanías en aguayo, venta de celulares, venta de salteñas.

El crédito que sacarán beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jhoselyn es integrante, ella indica que integra a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace varios años, ya que con los pocos ahorros que tuvo decidió emprender este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz y fideo por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto para posteriormente, a la elaboración, comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que vive en unión libre y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro  que ofrece la institución.

En la foto solo aparecen siete integrantes ya que la señora Julia, después del desembolso, se fue a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The group "Flor de Jhocelyn" will start its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is comprised of eight members, and is led by a board of directors, with Jhoselyn serving as president. The businesses the members run are: selling groceries, selling foods, selling fruit, selling artesanal woven goods, selling cell phones, and selling meat pies.

The loan they take out will benefit micro-businesses including Jhoselyn's business. She states that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Presently she has a business selling foods; she comments that she learned this work from her mother several years ago, and she decided to start her own business with the little savings she had.

The loan they are applying for now will go toward increasing her capital (buying rice and noodles at wholesale) which she will purchase through the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto, and then prepare them and sell in her space. This kind of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she lives with her partner and her daughter.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds she likes the savings the institution offers.

Only seven members appear in the photo because right after the loan disbursement Julia went to her sales space.

loans.use: buy rice and noodles at wholesale.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 61 years old and operates a convenience store. The store is the primary way he supports the needs of his family. He is married and has three, adult-aged children. In order to increase his inventory, he asks for a loan to restock the store with consumable items like canned goods, noodles, condiments and confectioneries.

loans.use: to restock the store with consumable items like canned goods, noodles, condiments and confectioneries.

loans.name: Glorieta

texts.en:
Glorieta is 58 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Glorieta has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use it in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Glorieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old and has five children. She is married, and three of her children are in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for three years and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
An $800.00 loan is offered to Adelina to improve her business. Adelina opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milks, water and Coca-Cola. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a bigger business after years of involving herself in doing business. Adelina is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milks, water and Coca-Cola.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 41 years old and married with seven children. Six of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Evangeline has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for four years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman, and she has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 46 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Evelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF, in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy is a 43-year-old man from a remote area of Kampong Speu Province. He is a father of five children. To make a living, he raises cows for sale. He is able to earn an income of around USD 10.00 per day, on average. So far, he has been involved in this kind of business for more than ten years.

He would like to improve his living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, he is asking for a loan with which to build a biogas digester. It will be under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program), in partnership with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and that he will reduce the smoke from wood- or charcoal-burning. He is very happy and thankful, because with this loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate compared to its general loans. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Even from the start, Shirley was determined and hardworking in running her variety store. However, she knows that without sufficient capital, all of the hard work will be of little worth. But when her previous loan was granted, the amount had been a great help. She bought stock of grocery items and necessary materials for her Xerox copying business.

She wants to thank lenders since the amount they have provided became a way to have a daily sales increase in her variety store. The business is growing since each month her total income is about PHP30, 000.

Shirley wants to thank as well Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for approving her previous loan. She is blessed for God’s abundance and the medium of blessing, CCT and all of the lenders with compassionate hearts. She’s also grateful as CCT conducts seminars for entrepreneurs.

This year, she is requesting another loan of PHP 20,000 to add for the business. She’ll utilize the amount if ever granted to buy additional grocery items such as bottled drinks, school supplies, sacks of rice and processed foods.

Shirley believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay micro finance loans and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items such as bottled drinks, school supplies, sacks of rice and processed foods for her variety store business.

loans.name: Ermilita

texts.en:
Ermilita is 55 years old. She's married and has three children. She helps her husband in supporting the needs of her children. She's engaged in a food vending business.

Recently, she joined GDMPC, and with the help of the cooperative, she was able to borrow a loan to purchase raw ingredients to prepare food to fulfill her customer's orders. She knows very well that with this investment, she will earn multiple returns.

She plans to use her income to improve the general living situation of her family and also for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to fulfill orders

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en: Marvie is a young entrepreneur from Mahayag, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married, 31 years old, and has one child to raise. She manages her own piggery raising pigs for sale to earn a living. Recently, she he joined Gata Daku MPC and was able to receive a loan to purchase feed for her piglets. She was able to gain access to the  services offered and it helped her to improve her ability to engage in business. She is hopeful enough to expand her piggery and gain more income for the better future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her piglets.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is thankful that there are people willing to help new entrepreneurs who are financially incapable. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 provided a way to increase her daily sales. Each month she earns around PHP 13,500. The previous loan was used to buy additional grocery items for her variety store business. She wants to thank every lender participating in the Kiva program because without their help she doesn’t know how to survive in the business, since even if one perseveres, it will not be enough unless you have the capital to use.

Luisa wants to have an established savings account for her family’s future, she also dreams of having her own supermarket someday. All with the help of the Lord, as He’s using people to help her not just financially but also giving knowledge on how to run the business the right way. Luisa prays that God may touch the hearts of the people who will read her story since she is once again applying for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of grocery items for the business.

Luisa regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Susie

texts.en:
Ma. Susie is 45 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is in school. Ma. Susie works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Ma. Susie has been in this business for 15 years. She sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future Ma. Susie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 56 years old and has six children. Narcisa is married, and one of her children is in school.

Narcisa is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Narcisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Narcisa has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ZAPATITO VELOZ” iniciará el ciclo treinta y cinco en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adalberta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, venta de api, servicio de construcción, venta de mantas, venta de detergentes, venta de carne.

El crédito que sacarán beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adalberta es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, al ayudarle a su mamá, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The loan group “Zapatito Veloz” will begin its thirty-fifth cycle in ProMujer, as part of the focus center of the Andes. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of members of which Adalberta is president. The businesses that the members of the loan group have are varied, among them there are: fruit sales, sales of api (non-alcoholic maize drink), construction services, blanket sales, detergent sales, and meat sales. 

The loan they will receive will benefit small micro companies where Adalberta is a member. She says that three years ago she joined ProMujer, joining because of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling fruits. She says she learned this business several years ago, helping her mother. With the passing of time, she decided to open an independent business.

The loan she will get now will be used to increase her capital (purchasing fruits at wholesale), which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of la Paz, and afterwards she will sell in her space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to help her family economically, as she is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about ProMujer, she answers that she likes the health area offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is married, and she works hard to support her family. She has a business selling dressed chickens in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from clothing retail sales.

Daisy is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more dressed chickens to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dressed chickens to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Nancy Asturia

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 50 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun  vive en su casa. Su esposo es taxista. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la ciudad.
Doña Nancy es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse lo suyo y así ayudar a su marido a salir adelante, para esto hace más de 10 años instaló un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, allí ella confecciona todo tipo de prendas pero de preferencia de damas y niños, en ocasiones elabora uniformes de escuelas y colegios pero esto en temporada de inicio de clases. Trabaja todos los días unas seis horas dependiendo de lo que tenga que confeccionar, en ocasiones ella contrata personal cuando tiene mucha costura por entregar,  actualmente espera comprar una maquina industrial y así mejorar la calidad de sus trabajos. 
Este crédito lo va  emplear en comprar materiales para la  costura y una máquina de coser industrial. Lleva más 4  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son  seguir mejorando su taller.
texts.en:
On San Eduardo Street, in the city of Portoviejo, known as the city of the Royal Tamarind since colonial times, every 15 days the members of the Loan Group 16 of July gather together. In this place lives Nancy, she is 50 years old, she cohabits and from this relationship she has four children who are adults. Only one of them still lives with her. 
Her husband is a taxi driver. A few years ago, she learned tailoring and dressmaking in an academy in the city. Nancy is a woman who has always liked to earn her own money, and help her husband to get ahead. This is why over 10 years ago she opened a small sewing workshop in her home. There she makes all types of garments, but mostly for women and children. Sometimes she makes school uniforms, buy only in the season when school starts. She works for six hours every day depending on what she has to make. Sometimes she hires workers when she has a lot of sewing to hand in.
Currently she hopes to buy an industrial machine, and improve the quality of her work.
This loan she will use to buy materials for sewing and an industrial sewing machine. She has been with the loan group for more than 4 years, and she likes it because with the loan she can get ahead. Her dreams are to keep improving her workshop.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing, and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jerlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Jerlyn is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Jerlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cables, sockets, switches, electrical boxes, and splitting tubes to finish the electrical installation on her house

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
O senhor Antonio tem 68 anos de idade , é casado e pai de 7 filhos 5 dos quais ja maiores de idade 01 ainda menor, e outro frenquentando o ensino primário, sustenta 4 netos que vivem com ele na casa própria .
Com o valor do credito pretende comprar blocos, cimento, areia, arame, chapas de zinco para dar continuidade a construcao de sua casa.
Tem como sonho ampliar a sua casa com mais um quarto, fazer instalacao electrica e mobilar a casa e com os emprestimos anteriores fez uma casa tipo 1 onde actualmente vive.
O seu maior desafio e a insuficiencia de fundos  e para ultrapassa-lo faz tambem machambas onde produz divesosos produtos para revender, mas diz que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para tal vai pagar pontualmente .
texts.en:
Antonio is 68 years old. He is married with 7 children, 5 of them of age, a small child and a child attending grade school. He also supports 4 grandchildren who live in the home that he owns.
He wants to use this loan to buy bricks, cement, sand, wire, zinc roofing sheets to continue building his home.
His dream is to finish the addition of a room to the house, finish the electrical installation and furnish it. He used the previous loans to build a one bedroom house, where he currently lives.
His biggest challenge is the lack of funds, so he has different jobs to produce items for sale. He wants to pay this loan on time, so he can have access to more funding in the future.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, wire, zinc roofing sheets

loans.name: Safarmahmud

texts.ru: Сафармахмуд живет в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Он женат и имеет 6 детей. Как и многие жители этого района, он занимается сельским хозяйством. У него большой участок земли 0,85 га, на котором он посадил разные зерновые овощные культуры. Однако для того чтобы земля каждый год давала хороший урожай ее необходимо постоянно  удобрять. Сафармахмуд с целью закупки минеральных удобрений и расширения своего дела обратился за кредитом. Сафармахмуд верит в Вашу доброту и с надеждой смотрит в будущее.
texts.en:
Safarmahmud lives in the Abdurahman Jomi region. He is married and has six children.

Like many residents of this region, Safarmahmud works with agriculture. He has a large plot of land of 0.85 hectares, on which he has sown different vegetables. However, in order to get a good harvest every year, the land repeatedly needs fertilizers.

With an aim to purchase mineral fertilizers and expand his business, Safarmahmud applied for a loan. Safarmahmud believes in your kindness and looks to the future with high hopes.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Eulalia Aracely

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Eulalia, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos mayores de  edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña 	Eulalia al igual que la mayoría de los miembros de su familia trabajan en un negocio familiar, ellos tienen una panadería muy cerca de su casa,  arriendan un local el cual por su ubicación sus ventas son muy buenas, allí ellos elaboran pan de varios sabores así como también tortas, roscas y muchos productos más que son el deleite de su clientes que a diario compran en su local, desde la madrugada ellos tienen preparado el pan para cuando sus clientes lleguen puedan llevarlo a sus mesas, de esta forma ellos satisfacen a sus clientes con un buen producto y mejor servicio, llevan más de 20 años trabajando en esta actividad la cual les permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar harina, huevos, azúcar y otros ingredientes para preparar el pan. Ella  está muy agradecida con la institución y con las personas que le ayudan para que pueda recibir los créditos. Sus sueños son tener su local propio.
texts.en:
The 16 de Julio (July 16th) communal bank meets every two weeks on San Eduardo street on the road to Santa Ana in the city of Portoviejo, known as the Royal Tamarind City since colonial times.

Eulalia lives in this place. She is 59 years old and is married with 8 grown children. Two of them still live with her. Her husband is an artisan.

Like the majority of the members of her family, Eulalia works in a family business. They have a bakery very close to her house. They rent a store and because of its location their sales are very good. There they make a variety of breads as well as cakes, doughnuts, and many other products, which are the delight of their customers who shop every day in their store. They have the bread ready at dawn so that when their customers arrive they can take it home to their tables. In this way they satisfy their customers with a good product and better service. They have been doing this work for more than 20 years and it allows them to earn a living.

This loan is to buy flour, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients to make the bread. She is very grateful to the institution and to the people who help them so that they can receive the loans. Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with four adult age children. She has been a vegetable farmer for 15 years.

She is financed by Paglaum MPC. Recently, she took a loan to purchase bags of cement, sticks, nails and other items. Juliet hopes that she can continuously maintain her good membership with the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, sticks, nails and other items.

loans.name: Angela Ramona

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 59 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, con ella vive una de sus hijas. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Ángela es una mujer que siempre ha querido mejorar su situación económica y su calidad de vida, ella la mayor parte de los créditos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para de a poco ir construyendo su hogar es así como durante los cinco años que lleva recibiendo los créditos casi tiene su casa terminada, actualmente le falta muy poco y es para eso que espera utilizar una parte de este crédito, para arreglar un baño que le hace mucha falta, una parte también es para que su marido lo utilice en materiales para realizar sus trabajos de cerrajería.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar materiales de construcción, soldaduras, hierro y otros materiales  que necesita el marido en su taller. Lleva 5 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos está por terminar su hogar. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
On San Eduardo Street, in the city of Portoviejo, known as the city of the Royal Tamarind since colonial times, every 15 days the members of the Loan Group 16 of July gather together. 
In this place lives Angela, she is 59 years old, she cohabits and from this relationship she has three children who are adults. She lives with one of her daughters. Her husband is a salesman. 
Angela is a woman who has always wanted to improve her economic situation and her quality of life. The largest part of the loans she has received, she has used to build her home little by little. It is in this way that in the five years she has been receiving the loans, she is almost finished. Currently, she only has a few things left, and it is for this that she hopes to use a part of this loan, to fix the bathroom, which really needs it. Another part will be so that her husband can use it on materials to do his work as a locksmith.
She will use this loan to to purchase construction materials, solders, iron, and other materials that her husband needs in his workshop. She has been in the loan group for five years, and she likes it because with the loans she is about to finish building her home. Her dreams are to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, solders, iron, and other materials.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 42 years old and married with two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emelda has an E-loading (mobile prepaid load) business in the Philippines. Emelda requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional prepaid load to sell to her customers.

Emelda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Emelda would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional prepaid phone load to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.pt:
