Now it is her main source of provision since she is a widow. Her main customers are friends, neighbors and referred customers. She sells them her products to order and they pay upfront or on credit.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in buying garments, such as blouses, jeans, sweaters, and dresses. She plans to travel to Medellín, which is the fashion capital in Colombia, where she will find new clothing collections of excellent quality at reasonable prices. This investment will be a success since the Día de Amor y Amistad (literally “Day of Love and Friendship”; Colombian equivalent of Valentine’s Day) is approaching, which is a season in which there is a boost in clothing sales.

Miriam’s goal for the future is to continue expanding her client base so she can have the resources to educate her youngest daughter to university level.

loans.use: to buy garments, such as blouses, jeans, sweaters, and dresses.

loans.name: Kangkhoumvangkhong Group

texts.en:
Dokmai is the leader of the Kangkhoumvangkhong Group, and along with other villagers the group participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. They also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases.

After totaling the costs Dokmai and his group recognized the substantial financial savings water filters would have for them and their families. The three TerraClear water filters Dokmai and his group decided to purchase for 1,500,000 LAK are guaranteed for two years but are known to function for up to five years. The group was particularly pleased that the filters could be paid for through an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to buy a TerraClear water filter.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a responsible mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 4 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because its current condition is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, Haleema's husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Haleema has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Haleema's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. This will provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Haleema also plans to gain savings with the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Haleema is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Oscar Roberto

texts.es:
Oscar, de 23 años de edad, creció con sus padres, quienes le enseñaron la agricultura, estudio hasta bachillerato y vive con sus padres.

Oscar, se dedica a trabajar sembrando maíz en las parcelas que alquila durante la mañana y en la tarde trabaja en una gasolinera, porque sus padres dependen de los ingresos que él obtiene.

Oscar, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas que le vende un vecino, porque desea iniciar a producir leche y sus padres le ayudaran a cuidarlas y a vender la leche en los alrededores de la comunidad.

Oscar, sueña con comprar más animales y un día producir lácteos para exportar.
texts.en:
Oscar, 23 years old, grew up with his parents who taught him agriculture. He studied as far as high school and lives with his parents.

Oscar works during the morning planting corn in rented plots, and in the evening he works as a gas station attendant because his parents depend on the income that he earns.

Oscar needs the loan to buy two cows that a neighbor is selling him, because he wants to begin producing milk. His parents will assist him to care for the cows and sell the milk in the surrounding areas.

Oscar dreams to buy more animals and one day to produce dairy products for export.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Lealiza

texts.en:
Lealiza, 25 years old, is married and has 3 children. She lives in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. Lealiza started hog raising when her neighbor offered a 70 / 30 sharing of profit (70% to the raiser and 30% the piglet owner).

Lealiza found that hog raising is a promising business and that she wanted to raise her own piglets. She signed up for membership at Paglaum MPC and borrowed the needed capital to start up her hog raising business. She successfully repaid her loan without default. Lealiza has now taken out a loan to buy additional piglets for fattening.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 26-year-old married woman who works in embroidering to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She has good skills in this domain for she learned it long ago from her mother.

Sanaa is trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions despite her limited income and her husband's limited salary. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary curtains for her house which will safeguard her security and privacy. This will provide her with comfort and a feeling of not being disturbed with the extra glare of lighting and vehicle movement. Sanaa hopes to stay capable of providing her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy curtains for her house which will safeguard her security and privacy

loans.name: Somnit

texts.en:
Somnit is a 21-year-old married factory worker with a dependent child in her care who lives in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has worked in the factory since 2005. Her husband is 31 years old and earns some income from rice cultivation and animal husbandry.

Both Somnit and her husband can make a daily income of $11 per day. She wants to buy piglets to fatten and sell but she does not have enough money, so she is now requesting a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI.

With the loan, she will have enough finances to buy piglets to fatten and earn additional income to improve her living standards. In the future, she wants to build a new proper house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten and sell

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
Rogelyn is 28 years old; she is married with an infant-age child. She is from R. J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

She runs a retailing business that is financed by Paglaum MPC.

Currently, she avails a loan to purchase inventory like canned goods, noodles, soy sauce and vinegar.

loans.use: to purchase inventory like canned goods, noodles, soy sauce and vinegar.

location.town: Sindangan-R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be loyal.

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use.

Her business goal is to have a big cosmetics business within five years.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Bedovita

texts.en: Bedovita is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, since she needs farm improvement.  In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to give her children the education she did not have. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Nalia

texts.en:
Nalia is a single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as being determined.

Nalia operates a retail business where she sells bedsheets, bed covers, and curtains. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of bed covers. She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bed covers

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está casado, es padre de dos hijos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y sus hijos están estudiando. 

Tomas, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado desde hace 20 años, se dedica a esta actividad porque le genera buenas ganancias, para poder llevar el sustento a su familia, en este negocio se involucra uno de sus hijos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar ganado, ya que quiere aprovechar que está barato y dentro de 1 años poder venderlo y obtener ganancias de la venta.

El sueño de Tomas, es trabajar duramente para comprar un camión, para transportar el ganado y mejorar el negocio.
texts.en:
Tomas, 46 years old, studied as far as first grade. He is married and father to two children. His wife works in the home and his children are in school.

Tomas has worked for 20 years buying and selling livestock. He is dedicated to this work because it generates good earnings to be able to sustain his family, and he involves one of his sons in the business.

He needs the loan to buy livestock, since he wants to benefit from the low prices. Within a year he can sell them and profit from the sale.

Tomas's dream is to work hard enough to buy a truck to transport the livestock and improve the business.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en:
Rubi, 33 years old, resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband runs his own business by providing the services of medicine sales and supplies.

Rubi's husband wants to purchase different types of medicines for resale but, due to insufficient financial means, is not in a position to buy them. Therefore Rubi has applied for a Kiva loan with BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her husband to purchase these medicines and enable him to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn a profitable income. Rubi's husband also plans to make savings with the income from his business to meet uncertain events in the future.

Rubi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's pharmacy business.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a 34-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been running an academy center for the past six years. Her husband is the guardian of the family and manages the entire household.

Kiran's husband needs to buy chairs, tables, advertising for the academy and other items for business purposes, but due to financial constraints her husband is unable to purchase these commodities.

Therefore Kiran has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her husband to buy these commodities for business purposes to earn maximum profitable income. This profitable income will also help him to make savings to meet the needs of the family and of the business.

Kiran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's education-providing business.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a 24-year-old single woman from Lebanon; she is living with her parents. Her father represents the main income source in the family, and he works very hard to always be able to fulfil the family's needs and to live in a good lifestyle.

In order to pay her university fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l.

She said that her target is to achieve higher positions and be able to support her father financially.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Mrs Dung is 32 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Dung lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in her village. Moreover, the income from her business is not high enough to do what she really needs to have comfort in her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 44 year old married woman who lives with her husband with no children Due to difficult economic conditions, Zeinab is obliged to work continually, as she is responsible for supporting her husband with their family expenses.

She opened a shop since 2011 where she sells scarfs and accessories. She provides her customers with good quality products. She is satisfied with what she has attained so far, although she wishes to enhance her family’s way of living even more.

Today, she’s asking or a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase merchandises. In the future, she plans to borrow additional loans with the aim to developing her work.

loans.use: to purchase merchandises

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en:
Arkadi lives in the village of Koghb, in the Tavush region, with his parents, wife and little daughter. Arkadi is involved in transporting and selling stone and sand to nearby communities. He owns a ZIL (Russian manufacturer) truck with which he organizes his transport. Arkadi's family also owns a farm, mainly run by Arkadi's mother and wife.

Arkadi needs this loan to purchase four new tires for his ZIL truck and to continue his work. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The support of lenders is very important for Arkadi to continue his work and to gather income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for four new tires for the ZIL truck.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be focused.

He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

Wilson will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

His business goal is to open a boutique within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to supply clothes to other towns.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito has been in a rice retailing business that is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC, where she is an active member. She is making good sales these days so she wants to grab the opportunity of providing enough supply of rice. For this reason, she asks for a loan from the cooperative. The amount that she borrows shall be used to purchase additional bags of rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Heuykeo Group

texts.en:
Seephone is the leader of this, the Heuykeo Group. Local water requires boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. Precious income must be spent to buy charcoal as well as time and energy used to forage for firewood. They well know the difference the water filters could make for their families.

Seephone and his group have decided to spend 2,000,000 LAK to buy TerraClear water filters. Buying these filters will result in an increase in the families’ disposable incomes and eliminate the need to buy bottled water if it is available. The filters are guaranteed for two years but are known to function for up to five years. Furthermore, the filters can be bought on an affordable payment schedule.

Seephone and his group are pleased that they will be able to receive the multiple benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to buy a TerraClear water filter.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casado, es padre de 1 hijo, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar. 

José, se dedica al comercio de ganado desde hace 10 años, este trabajo lo aprendió gracias a su hermano, pero además de la ganadería, también se dedica a la siembra de maicillo.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar ganado, para engordarlo y venderlo para obtener ganancias.

El sueño de José, es mejorar su casa, para que su hijo pueda tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
José, 47 years old, attended school until the fourth grade. He is married and has one son. His wife takes care of the household.

José has worked in the cattle business, which he learned from his brother, for ten years. But in addition to ranching, he also raises sorghum.

He needs this loan to purchase cattle, fatten it up, and sell it for profit. José's dream is to improve his home, so his son can have a decent life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Aiida

texts.en: Aiida is a 47-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children, some still attending school. She is a housewife who is dedicated to her home and family. Aiida's husband owns a blacksmith shop in his town and is the main income provider, but his income is barely sufficient. Therefore Aiida is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay her children’s educational fees.  She says that this loan will surely help her to ensure the school year for her children, which makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is married and has one child. She describes herself to be innovative. For the past ten years, Faith has operated a retail business selling maize flour, sugar, bread, soap and other items. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

Faith describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, milk and other items. She hopes that, in the future, she will own a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, milk and other items.

loans.name: Arrolyn

texts.en: Arrolyn has been in the retailing business of various consumable goods that sufficiently provides for her needs. She is single and wants to secure her future knowing she has nobody to take good care of her when she's old. Arrolyn is making good sales and hopes to provide more for her customers. For this reason, she has applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC. The amount that she borrows will be used to purchase additional inventory of consumable goods for sale.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of consumable goods for sale.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia, a 33-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Intramuros, Manila City, Philippines, has run her accessory store for almost ten years, and she makes a good income from this. Her husband works also as a vendor and they are both determined to work hard to provide their children a better education than they currently have.

In her trade, she buys a quantity of phone accessories on a wholesale basis and sells them with a small profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

Recently, she had a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 and re-payed it faithfully. Now, Antonia is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan assistance to purchase a greater quantity of products to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Antonia hopes to expand her stall and make her children finish their schooling. She also aspires to have a stable job so she can earn a living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories like batteries and chargers

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Doña leonor de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos desde hace 27 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, Doña Leonor esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas pollos por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y asi tene mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Leonor is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her daughter. She has earned a living selling chicken for 27 years. Her business is located in her home, and she has a lot of customers. Leonor is requesting a loan to buy more chickens at wholesale in order to continue with her sales and thus have a better financial income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens at wholesale.

loans.name: Pampila

texts.en: Pampila, 60 years old, lives in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is widowed and has five adult children. For the past ten years, Pampila has owned and operated a business providing transport to local community members. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase a slightly used motorcycle. Pampila is a microfinance member of PMPC. In the future, Pampila hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a slightly used motorcycle

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
For more than five years, Jacqueline, 35 years of age, from Intramuros, Manila, has run a sari-sari (variety store) business. This business has helped her a lot in providing for her family's needs on a daily basis.

Sari-sari stores are seen everywhere in the Philippines. They provide people with products mostly needed in everyday survival - from items for personal hygiene (shampoo, toothpaste, powder) to condiments, foods, canned goods and other low-cost items. This is why many of those who want to go into business often start with being a sari-sari vendor because, with just a small amount of capital, you can automatically operate a store and earn an income.

Jacqueline expects more customers to purchase her products, which will enable her to gradually gain progress through her business. To realize this expectation, she has already borrowed a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva. She now wants to acquire another loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more merchandise to sell. She truly hopes for your generosity and understanding.

Jacqueline meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Currently, the economy of the nation tends to reach its stability due to the different programs the government has been offering to its citizens to eliminate poverty, and because of this most Filipinos today have engaged themselves not just in employment but also in a micro-business approach.

One of them is Maribel. Realizing her part in economic growth, she works hard to maintain her food store business. Usually, she sells bread, assorted juices and other form of snacks. One day, she yearns to grow this business and help other people also.

But of course before that, she wants to expand her own business by acquiring additional capital. She will use this to increase the volume of products she has available to sell, which will definitely lead her into having a profit increase.

This will be a great help for her since she is now sending her children to school. She wants them to have better education. That’s why she is hopeful that you would grant her the PHP 10,000 loan that she is requesting. This will definitely make her inventory better.

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to increase the volume of products she has to sell in her food store.

loans.name: Joseck

texts.en: Joseck is a Kiva borrower. He has 6 children. He operates a posho mill where he sells maize flour. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the breakdown of his machine. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more maize. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more maize

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Success will always follow if you have determination and hope.

Here is Bernardita, a woman driven with eagerness to work hard for her family. She is already 37 years of age and currently resides at Intramuros, Manila City, Philippines. What she basically does right now is managing a small hardware shop in her community. Her husband, Rodel, is already 40 years old and through working hand in hand, they survive daily expenses through what they generate from the shop.

Now, she wants to avail herself of a loan amounting to 20 000 PHP which she will use to buy materials needed for improving the shop itself. This will greatly help the family to gain a higher income than usual, which, as a result, will make them a little better off than usual hopefully. This can only happen through your tender hearts which are willing to help.

Bernardita's dreams are simple. She just wants her children to complete college, her business to suddenly expand and then help other people someday like you people are helping her.

She truly hopes for your affirmative response regarding this matter.

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for improving her hardware shop.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis has been doing retail business in Bagratashen village for many years. He brings different food and home supplies from the neighbouring country, using his car as a truck, and sells the products in his village. Aramayis mostly trades in food oil, washing dust and powders and different kinds of home supplies. Aramayis's main support in the business is his father. Aramayis lives with his parents, and three sisters. He has now applied for this loan to make last payment on the vehicle which he uses in his retail business for transporting products.

Aramayis has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, the support of lenders is very important for this young and hardworking man to own the car and continue his retail business in remote village of Tavush region.

loans.use: to make the last payment on the truck which is used in his retail business.

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es: Ovidio de 61 años es un pensionado que reside en un barrio ubicado al sur de Barranquilla y  con el paso de los años decidió emprender nuevos retos que le permitieran mantenerse en actividad constante y en ningún caso una vida pasiva, por lo tanto vio en su vivienda una oportunidad de negocio al contar con una amplia extensión y poderla convertir en un proyecto de apartamentos para arrendar. No tuvo ningún reparo en iniciar la remodelación y tener éxito en su negocio, en la actualidad recibe los canon de los arriendo mensualmente y la calidad de vida de su familia es mucho mejor, por eso está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para realizarle adecuaciones y reparaciones a sus apartamentos.  Esta inversión es muy importante para mejorar las condiciones de habitabilidad y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus inquilinos. Su meta a futuro es continuar realizándole mejoras a los apartamentos e incrementar su canon y tener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Ovidio, age 61, is a pensioner who lives in a neighborhood located to the south of Barranquilla.

Over the years, he decided to take on new challenges that would allow him to keep constantly active, and never, under any circumstance, live a passive life. Therefore, he saw a business opportunity in his home, as it has a large extension that he could convert into a project of rental apartments, and he had no qualms about beginning the renovations, or about being successful in his business. Now he receives rental income every month, and his family's quality of life is much better.

That is why he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to refurbish and repair his apartments. This investment is very important for improving the habitability and for offering better service to his tenants. His goals for the future are to continue making improvements to the apartments, increase his rental income, and have more profits.

loans.use: to refurbish and repair his apartments.

loans.name: Marcos Amador

texts.es:
Don Marcos tiene 60 años es productor orgánico y dentro de las actividades que realiza esta la albañilería y promotor de salud y agente comunitario tiene 5 hijos de (36-34-31-28-26) años.Es un productor responsable entusiasta reconocido en la organización dentro de sus expectativas a futuro están sacar agua del suelo y construir un reservorio para poder regar el cultivo de tara y así incrementar su producción.
Tiene 20 años en el negocio de la tara le gusta por ser un cultivo rentable que le permite la optimizar de la canasta
familiar.
texts.en: Don Marcos is 60 years old and is an organic farmer. His activities include working in masonry, as a health promoter and as a community representative.  He has 5 children ages 36, 34, 31, 28, and 26. He is an enthusiastic and responsible grower who is well known within the organization. Among his future plans are to pump groundwater, and build a reservoir to irrigate his tara trees and thus increase production. He has 20 years of experience growing tara trees and he likes it because it is a profitable business that allows him to optimize his family's finances.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for the cultivation of tara trees.

loans.name: Vunny

texts.en:
Vunny is 30 years old, a married mother with three children in her care, and lives in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than ten years, has extensive experience, and is successful in her career. She is involved in feeding pigs and poultry. Her husband is a 35-year-old blacksmith in the city, and she has one child who attends school. Together, she and her husband can earn approximately USD8 per day.

Vunny would like to request a loan because she is short of the funds to buy pig feed for her pigs. This loan will help her have enough funds to buy pig feed and improve her family’s finances from selling those pigs. In the future, she is going to buy more pigs and cows, build a new house and support her children to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for her pigs

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
SEM, 63 years old, is a lovely mother of one child. She lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small piece of farmland which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, she can generate an income of USD 4.00 per day.

She is living in an old house and she wants to build a comfortable one for her family. As there is a shortage of budget, she is now applying for a KIVA loan through HKL to buy construction supplies to build a new house. Through this loan, she hopes she can experience living in a comfortable house. She is thankful to all lenders with their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to build a new house

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es: Doña Bernardina de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 12 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña Bernardina, age 60, lives in her own house with her family. She has had a small store in her place of residence for twelve years, and she has many customers because of her good prices and friendly service. She is requesting a loan in order to be able to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, sweet bread, etc., and in this way, have more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Santana

texts.es:
Santana, de 53 años de edad, creció con su padre quien le enseño la agricultura; estudio hasta sexto grado, vive solo con su padre porque nunca se casó. 

Santana, se dedica a trabajar en las parcelas que alquila y en la tarde se dedica a cuidar una finca que se encuentra en los alrededores de donde él vive.

Santana, necesita el préstamo para comprar los insumos agrícolas como abono, semilla y pesticidas que necesita para poder sembrar.

Santana, sueña con comprar vacas lecheras, para empezar a producir leche y obtener un ingreso adicionales.
texts.en:
Santana is 53 years old, and he grew up with his father who taught him farming. He studied through the sixth grade, and lives alone with his father because he never got married. Santana earns a living working on the plots of land that he rents, and in the afternoon he looks after a property that is located in the surroundings of where he lives.

Santana is requesting a loan to buy farming inputs such as manure, seeds, and pesticides that he needs in order to be able to plant. Santana dreams of buying milk cows to begin producing milk and obtain an additional income.

loans.use: to buy farming inputs such as manure, seeds, and pesticides that he needs in order to be able to plant.

loans.name: Delice

texts.en:
Delice is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in Rwanda's capital of Kigali with her three siblings. The first in her family to attend university, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year due to her tremendous academic performance.

Delice plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to contribute through working in business, while supporting her family and the most vulnerable members of her community.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Filipinos love balot and penoy. Such foods are egg chicks and it's probably due to their favorable price plus their undeniable delicious taste that Filipinos favor them. Having then the opportunity to sell such foods, Marlyn, 43, who is a very hard-working entrepreneur from Intramuros, Manila, Philippines, engaged herself in this business. Together with her husband, Rodrigo, their income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures. Aside from this business, Marlyn also supervises an e-load business as seen in the picture above.

Marlyn buys bulks of balot and penoy (kinds of street foods) from her suppliers and then sells them in the market or distributes them by night. Her store is located in Baseco, Manila. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

Marlyn is requesting an PHP 8,000 loan to purchase more stock of balot and penoy to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she hopes to expand soon. Marlyn meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of balot and penoy to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 5 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en un zona muy transitada, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con su familia, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: carne, pollo, huevos, arroz, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, refrescos, etc. todo por mayor y asi poder seguir teniendo ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face has been pixelated, because she is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, has earned a living selling food for five years. Her business is located close to where she lives in a high-traffic area. With the earnings she obtains she is able to get ahead with her family.

The young woman lives in her own home with her husband and her child. She is newly requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as meat, chicken, eggs, rice, vegetables, fruit, sodas, drinks, etc. all at wholesale. This way she can keep having financial incomes.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as meat, chicken, eggs, rice, vegetables, fruit, sodas, drinks, etc. all at wholesale.

loans.name: Melikhon

texts.ru: Мелихон 57 лет, проживает в районе Хуросон. Она хорошая жена и мать четверых детей. Уже 15 лет как они с мужем занимаются животноводством.  Разводят крупнорогатый скот и продают мясо и молочные продукты на рынке. В данный момент они хотят расширить свой бизнес. Мелихон хочет закупить еще несколько голов животных, а также приобрести для них комбикорм и построить специальный загон. Но, к сожалению, достаточных средств для осуществления этих планов у нее нет. Именно с этой целью она обращается к Вам и надеется на положительный ответ с Вашей стороны на ее запрос.
texts.en:
Melikhon is 57 years old and lives in the Khuroson area. She is a good woman and mother of four children. She and her husband have been engaged in animal husbandry for 15 years. They breed cattle and sell meat and dairy products at the market. Currently, they want to expand their business. 

Melikhon wants to buy a few more heads of cattle, and also obtain mixed fodder for them, and build a special enclosure. However, unfortunately she has not enough funds to accomplish this plan. She is turning to you with this goal, and hopes for a positive response from you to her request.

loans.use: to purchase a few heads of calves.

loans.name: Nelson Ricardo

texts.es: nelson de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su taxi desde hace 27 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nelson, 47 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has been providing transportation in his taxi for 27 years, and has many clients who prefer him because he is so responsible when he drives. With what he earns from his work, Nelson is able to settle the costs of his home. He is requesting a loan to purchase tires and do maintenance on his vehicle, since it's his only means of work, and can ensure a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tires and do maintenance work on his vehicle.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in Rwanda's capital of Kigali with her mother and four siblings. Because of her tremendous academic performance, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Benita plans to major in Health Care Management and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to manage a hospital or a health NGO. She is also inspired by UNICEF and hopes to make a positive contribution to youth through opening a childcare center.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es: Doña Candida de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella posee una libreria y un centro de copias y trabajos en computadora desde hace 8 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de atender a sus clientes, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de cartuchos de tintas, resmas de papel, utiles escolares, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con su tabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Doña Candida, age 50, lives in her own house with her three children. She has had a bookstore and a copy center, and has been working with computers for eight years. Her business is located in her place of residence, and she has many customers because of the friendly service she gives them. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of ink cartridges, reams of paper, school supplies, etc., at wholesale, in order to continue with her work, as it is her only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase ink cartridges, reams of paper, school supplies, etc., at wholesale.

loans.name: Gloria Susana

texts.es: Gloria de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros,  desde hace 2 años, cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar ,ella esta solicita un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old, and she lives in her own home with her family group. She has earned a living selling underwear for men and women for two years. She has a lot of fixed customers that can keep her business afloat.

With the earnings she receives from her sales she is able to cover some of the home expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of underwear at different prices, styles, and colors, and in this way count on more customers and thus improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of underwear at different prices, styles, and colors.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Don Andres de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 45 años experiencia que le ha dado la oportunidad de vender una buena calidad de producto por esa razón posee clientes fijos, Don Andres está solicitando un crédito ya que necesita comprar las herramientas necesarias para continuar con su trabajo como: trasmallos, redes y darle mantenimiento a la lancha que muestra en la fotografía ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y de ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Andres, 65 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked as an artisanal fisherman for 45 years, experience which has enabled him to sell a high quality product. He has fixed clients for this very reason.

Don Andres is requesting a loan because he needs to buy tools necessary for maintaining his business, such as trammels and nets. He also needs to do maintenance on his boat, which is featured in the photograph, and is his only means of employment and income.

loans.use: to purchase trammels and nets, and to do maintenance on his boat.

loans.name: Savrigul

texts.ru: Савригул молодая женщина из района Кудабиён. Ей 31 год. Она замужем и в браке имеет двоих детей. Савригул с юных лет занимается животноводством. Она начала работать на скотном дворе еще в родительском доме и после замужества продолжила работу у мужа в доме. Савригул любит свою работу, потому что ее дети всегда обеспечены свежим молоком и молочными продуктами. Савригул просит купить еще одного теленка. Тогда она сможет получить дополнительный доход от продажи молока. Ее капитал не позволили ей совершить покупку, и она обратилась за заемными средствами. Вы можете сейчас поддержат Савругула.
texts.en:
Savrigul is a young woman from the Qubadiyon district of Tajikistan.  She is 31 years old and married.  She and her husband have two children.  She has been raising cattle from the time she was a young girl as she used to help her parents around the family's farm.  After she got married, she continued the same activity in her new home, with her husband.

Savrigul loves her work.  Thanks to her activity, her children always receive fresh milk and dairy products.  She now wants to buy one additional heifer, so that she can sell more milk and increase her income.  Her own resources are not enough for this purchase, so for this reason, Savrigul is taking a loan.  Please support her!

loans.use: to buy one heifer.

loans.name: Roxana Del Transito

texts.es: Roxana de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, desde hace 7 años posee una carnicería ubicada en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza y las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas carne por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Roxana, age 44, lives in her own house with her family. She has had a butcher's shop in her place of residence for more than seven years. She has many customers because of her good prices, and with the earnings she obtains from her sales, she manages to get along. She is requesting a new loan for the purchase of more meat at wholesale, so that she will be able to continue with her sales and have better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase more meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Señor Del Calvario De Huariquiña Group

texts.es: El grupo “SEÑOR DEL  CALVARIO DE HUARIQUIÑA” está conformado por socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Jannina tiene 35 años de edad es soltera con dos hijos educando. Ella implemento su pequeña  bodega en su vivienda hace varios el cual ha ido implementando con todos los productos de primera necesidad  útiles de aseso y limpieza. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes bebidas jabones cepillos dentales detergentes lejía. Para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus clientes ya fidelizados. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Jannina es la segunda persona sentada del lado derecho viste casaca marrón.
texts.en:
Señor del Calvario de Huariquiña Group is made up of members who work in retail.

Jannina, 35, is single and raising two children. Several years ago she set up her small grocery store in her home and has been supplying it with all the staples, personal hygiene products, and cleaning supplies.

She's going to invest the loan in a purchase of more groceries, beverages, soap, toothbrushes, detergent, and bleach to satisfy the basic needs of the customers who are already loyal to her.

The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan granted. Jannina is the second person seated on the right; she's wearing a brown jacket.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, cleaning products, and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Rayhona

texts.ru: Райхона 37 летняя женщина. Она из района Хуросон. Райхона замужем и мать троих детей. Муж на заработках в Российской Федерации. Райхона живет вместе с детьми. Она в родном районе занимается животноводством. 9 лет она выращивает скота у себя во дворе. В работе ей помогает дети. Дети является единственным помощником. Райхона просит кредит для договора учебы сына и купли одежды на учебу. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку. Ей больше никуда обратится за кредитом.
texts.en: Rayhona is 37 and she comes from the Khuroson district of Tajikistan.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia.  Rayhona lives alone with her children and is involved in animal husbandry, having raised cattle at home for the past nine years.  Her children help her with the farm work and are their mom's only support.  Rayhona is taking a loan to pay for her son's tuition fees and to buy some clothes for school.  She is hoping to receive your support, as she had nowhere else to turn to, to get a loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's annual tuition.

loans.name: Jose Lino

texts.es: Jose de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, su hijo y su hermano, el se dedica a la elaboración de lavaderos de concreto desde hace 31 años y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de cemento, hierro y arena para la elaboración de los lavaderos y asi continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
José, 56, lives in his own home with his wife and brother.

He has earned a living for 31 years making concrete sinks, and he has steady customers. He's able to pay for some of his household expenses with what he earns from his job.

José is requesting another loan to buy cement, rebar, and sand to make sinks. That way he can continue with his job, which is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy cement, rebar, and sand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for university fees.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora, dueña de su propio negocio, del cual le ha servido muchísimo para poder emprender en el ambiente laboral. A sus 26 años, casada, y con dos hijos de 6 y 1 ½ años. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, costura y es estilistas. Con ayuda de su esposo pudo comenzar estas actividades. Entre sus metas esta poder agrandar más su mercadería, es por eso que requiere del préstamo para la compra de zapatos, ropa íntima y ropa variada para su clientela.
texts.en:
Juana is a persisentent, hardworking woman who is the owner of her own business, which has helped her make her way in the workplace. 

At 26 years old, she is married and has two children who are six and one and a half years old. She sells clothing and works as a seamstress and a stylist. 

With the help of her husband she was able to start this business. One of her goals is to expand her merchandise, and for this reason she needs this loan in order to purchase shoes, underwear, and a variety of clothing for her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, underwear, and a variety of clothing for her clientele.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Фируз проживает на районе Шахритус, в самой солнечной стороне Республики. Фируз женатый мужчина в возрасте 30 лет у него трое детей. Фируз ответственный человек и приятен в общении. Фируз занимается животноводством. Он не оставил своих близких и не уехал на заработки как многие мужчины района. Фируз остался на Родине и занялся животноводством. Сейчас у него мало количество скотин он планирует расширить свой бизнес, за счет увеличения поголовья скота. Но его планам не суждено сбыться если он не найдет финансовой поддержки. Он обратился за кредитом, с надеждой на то, что с помощью кредита он сможет купить пару голов скота, расширить бизнес.
texts.en:
Firuz lives in the Shahrituz area, in the sunniest part of the republic. Firuz is 30 years old and married. He has three children. Firuz is a responsible and agreeable person. Firuz is engaged in animal husbandry. He has not left his loved ones and he did not go overseas for work like many of the men in the area. Firuz has stayed in his homeland and occupied himself with animal husbandry. 

Now he has not enough cattle, and he is planning to expand his business by increasing his livestock headcount. However his plans cannot succeed if he does not find financial support. He has applied for a loan, hoping that with the help of a loan, he will be able to buy a pair of cattle, and expand his business.

loans.use: to obtain cattle.

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en:
Him is a rice farmer living in Kampong Cham province. She is 30 years old and a mother of two children who are both in school. She has been involved in her farming business for 12 years and being a paid worker is an additional source of income for her. Through these jobs, she can earn about 12 USD per day. Weeds and insect destruction of her crop became her main challenge in earning income to support her family.

This is the third loan cycle for her with VisionFund. She has already repaid her past loans, which helped her to increase her daily income and to have enough to cover her household's consumption. Now, Him has decided to lead a group to apply for a new Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizer to boost her crop yields. She hopes that she will be able to earn more income to keep sending her children to school and to increase her ability to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to boost her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto es de la ciudad de Caaguazú está en el cuarto año de la carrera de contabilidad, está poniendo todo su esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Él es una persona muy luchadora que está poniendo todo de sí para poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Modesto is from the city of Caaguazú and is in his fourth year of his accounting degree. He's putting all of his effort into making something out of himself in life. 

He is a hardworking person who is putting everything into helping others through his knowledge. 

He is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay for his school fees and thus continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay for his college fees.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita, 51, a resident of Intramuros, Manila City, Philippines. Despite her age, she’s still buckling down and doing everything she can to provide for the family in spite of the breadline. She has been into operating a sari-sari (variety) store for years now and she really longs to improve it.

Carmelita would like to acquire financial assistance worth PHP 20,000 that she’ll utilize in purchasing more merchandise to sell. With a sound mind and clear hope, she dreams of her family succeeding someday and making a difference with her business. And this dream starts now, with you.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Thania

texts.es:
Thania es de la ciudad de Pilar, hace dos años terminó la carrera de Análisis de Sistemas, actualmente está cursando la carrera de Administración Ganadera.
Su meta es presentar y defender su tesis de analista de sistemas, luego seguir con la licenciatura en Administración Ganadera. Es una persona muy luchadora y sacrificada que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder pagar ese gasto que tiene de poder cubrir esta necesidad que tiene.
texts.en:
Thania is from Pilar.  Two years ago she completed the work for her degree in Systems Analysis.  She is currently taking courses in Ranching Administration. 
Thania's goal is to present and defend her Systems Analysis thesis and later continue with her degree in Ranching Administration.  She is a very hard-working and selfless person who wants to get ahead. 
Thania is asking for this loan to be able to cover the costs related to receiving her degree; she needs to be able to cover that expense.

loans.use: to pay for expenses related to receiving her degree.

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Liza continua luchando y esforzándose por terminar su carrera en auditoria y contabilidad, es una persona muy sacrificada que poco a poco esta poniendo todo de si para poder ser alguien en la vida. Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder cubrir parte de sus gastos de titulacion.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder cubrir nuevamente ese gasto que tiene para poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Liza continues fighting and making an effort to finish her degree in auditing and accounting. She is a very selfless person who little by little is putting forth all of herself to be someone in life. She comments that she used her previous loan to cover part of the expenses of her degree.

Today she asks for a new loan to pay the fees for her degree, and with that cover again that expense that she has to be able to study.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, gracias al apoyo de su familia ha podido ir mejorando poco a poco. Ella está trabajando y a la vez también estudia, y por medio de su trabajo puede cubrir un poco de los gastos de sus estudios.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por poder crecer.
texts.en:
Gloria is studying business administration. Thanks to the support of her family, she has been able to improve little by little. She is working and at the same time she studies, and through her work she can cover a little of the expenses of her studies.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay her university fees and in that way be able to continue with her studies, fighting to be able to grow.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
In the Philippines, sari-sari stores are everywhere. Sari-sari (a term used for variety) stores sell different kinds of products like biscuits, candies, canned goods, noodles, products used for personal hygiene and the like, which are involved in every individual’s daily living. This is considered one of the most common businesses built by ordinary people since it provides commodities for people.

Because of this fact, Elsie was enticed to get in touch with this kind of craft. She is 40 years old, married to Deorendo and a resident of Intramuros, Manila City, Philippines. By now, they are working with determination to pursue the needs of their family. The income they get from the store helps them with their daily expenditures.

However, whatever profit they get from the business is sometimes insufficient. At times, Elsie finds it hard to maintain supplies of various products due to financial incapability. This is why she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan that she will utilize to buy additional products for her inventory. With more products displayed in her store, she can ably have a greater increase in her income.

In due time, she hopes that she will grow in progress and that her sales will increase. Through this, she can earn and save money for a house someday if God will allow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for her inventory.

loans.name: Behruz

texts.ru:
Этого молодого человека из района А.Чоми зовут Бехруза. Ему 22 года. Он недавно окончил Университет и получил специальность учителя таджикского языка и таджикской литературы. Сейчас он работает учителем в местной школе. Отец и сестра Бехруза тоже учителя. Так как заработная плата учителя не большая Бехруз параллельно занимается земледелием. 
  На данный момент Бехруз планирует посадить новый урожай. Сначала ему придется очистить землю, обработать и подготовить землю и посеять семена. По этой причине он обращается за кредитом. Бехруз просит помочь ему купить минеральные удобрения и семена. Бехруз надеется ему помогут и заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
This young man from A. Jomi area is Behruz. He is 22 years old. He graduated from university not long ago and received a degree in teaching Tajik language and Tajik literature. Now he is working as a teacher at a local school. Behruz's father and sister are also teachers. Since the pay for teachers is not very good, Behruz also is engaged in farming. 

Currently, Behruz is planning to plant new crops. First he needs to decontaminate the land, go over it with fertilisers and prepare it, and sow the seeds. For this reason he is applying for a loan. Behruz requests to be helped with buying mineral fertilisers and seeds. Behruz hopes you will help him and expresses his thanks in advance.

loans.use: to obtain mineral fertilisers and seeds.

loans.name: Jannina

texts.es:
Jannina es una estudiante muy sacrificada, se considera una chica responsable, aplicada, comenta que proviene de una familia humilde donde le enseñaron los valores fundamentales. En un futuro se ve recibida y trabajando en su profesión, la cual es la licenciatura en bioquímica que tanto le gusta.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar la mensualidad de su universidad, y cubrir esa necesidad que tiene y continuar así con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jannina is a very selfless student. She considers herself a responsible and hardworking girl. She comments that she comes from a humble family where they taught her basic values. In the future she sees herself graduating and working in her profession, which is a degree in biochemistry that she likes so much.

She asks for this loan in order to pay her university fees and cover that need that she has, and continue in that way with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
“I want to expand my business because I want my children to finish their studies someday. There is nothing more that I can give to them but a quality education, which will lead them to better lives and careers,” said Editha, 35, from Intramuros, Manila.

For ten years now, she has been operating a food vending business in their community aside from her newsstand business that she had developed using her recent loan from Kiva. This is a good source of income for her since her common patrons are mostly from her neighborhood. With her different food products and dishes, she is able to earn at least PHP 15,000 a month, which serves as remedy for her family’s diverse expenses and needs.

She and her husband are dreaming of upgrading their socio-economic status. Starting to work for their aspirations, she wants to develop her food vending inventory by asking for a loan that she will use to purchase more ingredients and food products for sale. PHP 12,000 will be enough to realize this.

With hope and trust, she believes that you will help her again grasp what she is planning to enhance with her current food vending business.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more newspapers for her newsstand.

loans.name: Daline

texts.en: Daline is a 51-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is still attending school. She is a housewife taking care of her children and she received a retirement pension every month, in addition to her children's contributions. Today, she is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child's educational fees and to register him for the new school year. She states that she is very happy that she will be able to ensure him a secure educational path.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees and to register him for the new school year.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Это женщина Мухабат . Она проживает в районе Кубадиён вместе с семьей. Мухабат шустрая, гостеприимная и приятная в общение женщина. У нее четверо детей в возрасте 15, 13, 11 и 7 лет. Мухабат занимается продажей миндаля вот уже 10 лет. Навыков торговли она обучилась у своей мамы. До сих пор она использует ее советы в работе. Мухабат хочет увеличить доход от бизнеса, так как растут расходы детей и их надо покрывать, также Мухабат копит денеги на образования детей. Мухабат приняла решение обратиться за кредитом и купить больше миндаля и увеличить объем товара. Поддержите Мухабат в ее решение.
texts.en:
This woman is Muhabat. She lives in Qubadiyon area with her family. Muhabat is a bright, welcoming and pleasant woman. She has four children, and they are 15, 13, 11 and 7 years old. Muhabat has been selling almonds for a living for 10 years. She learned the skills of the trade from her mother. To this day, she uses her mother's advice at work. 

Muhabat wants to increase her income from her business, since she needs to cover the growing expenses for her children. Muhabat is also saving money for her children's education. Muhabat decided to apply for a loan and buy more almonds to increase her sales volume. Please support Muhabat and her decision.

loans.use: to buy almonds.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose vive en la ciudad de Itá, con sus padres y sus 2 hermanos, está en el último año de la carrera de Contabilidad, trabaja en dos estudios contables hace más de 3 años. 
Su objetivo es terminar la carrera el próximo año y mudarse a asunción y abrir su propio estudio contable.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his parents and two siblings in the city of Itá. He is in the last year of his accounting degree and has been working in two accounting firms for the last three years. His goal is to finish his studies next year and move to Asunción and open his own accounting firm. 

He is asking for this loan in order to pay for his school fees and thus continue his studies. 

He is thankful for this opportunity he is receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay his college fees.

loans.name: Rafaella

texts.es:
Rafaella es una persona muy sacrificada que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida, sigue luchando para poder ser una licenciada en nutrición. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en poder pagar las clases y cuotas de su carrera, es una persona que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide hoy este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma seguir luchando por sus metas y anhelos personales.
texts.en:
Rafaella is a very dedicated person who is putting all her effort into being somebody in life. She continues struggling in order to become a licensed nutritionist. 

She used her last loan to pay for her classes and school fees. She wants to improve her quality of life and that of her loved ones.

She is asking for this loan today in order to once again pay for her school fees and thus continue working to achieve her goals and personal dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her college fees.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 50-year-old, Lebanese, married woman living with her husband and three children who are attending school.

Her husband is the main income source in the family; he owns a bakery with the aim to fulfill the family's needs and lifestyle.

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will pay her children’s educational fees. it makes her very happy and optimistic, and she is willing to borrow Kiva loans to continue paying the fees.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
“It is good to have a source of income and more fun when you enjoy what you do.” This is how Juditha, 59, encourages herself and also the other people around her.

She sells various merchandise products through her sari-sari (variety) store in her area at Batasan, Quezon City. She has been running this business for over seven years, and she knows that this can still expand or grow if she only had enough business capital. If only she had visible resources, for sure there is a great possibility that Juditha can widen her trade.

Now she wants to acquire again a loan from Kiva for buying more merchandise products. It is because usually she runs out of stock due to financial issues. In order to continually satisfy the demand of her “sukis," or regular customers, she comes to Kiva through CCT, a group of ministries in the Philippines, for a PHP 50,000 loan. She views this opportunity as a start of a greater milestone ahead for her. She has proven before in her recent loan her faithfulness in repaying, and she hopes that you entrust her the same this time.

She is hoping that one day, she will become an inspiration to the other entrepreneurs who will enter into this kind of business as she establishes a supermarket, which is her ultimate dream.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a clean, secure place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient funds.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more fish. Her business goal is to own a fish pond within five years.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Noong Luong 30 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ban, 34, is a Thai ethnic lady who has been married and became the mother of two: a boy and a girl. She lives with her husband and her children in an old, small house at a remote village and works very hard at agricultural production for a living. Indeed, she and her husband cultivate rice and breed pigs and chickens.

Recently, she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy chicks and food to raise them. She hopes that the chickens will grow fast and bring a good income for her when she sells them.

Mrs. Ban dreams that she could build a new, better house and send her children to the good college to make their future brighter and help them escape from poverty.

In the picture, she is the woman with a beautiful smile and stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy chicks and food to raise them

loans.name: Thembi

texts.en:
Thembi (62) is a mother of two boys and one girl. Both Thembi and her husband have no income and rely on their children to support them. Thembi, however, is full of vigor and determined to make a living for herself and for her husband. "I want to be the one helping my children," says Thembi.

She is requesting a Kiva to loan to buy organic vegetables and fertilizer. She has some space behind her yard and wants to plant vegetables for sale. With the loan, she will buy the needed raw materials as well as install water pipes to tend to the crops.

Her husband will distribute the vegetables around the neighborhood and sell to small shops as well.

Thembi hopes to make enough profits to support her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy organic vegetables and fertilizer and install water pipes.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Isidro es un grupo nuevo, el cual está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres humildes que están luchando para poder salir adelante y dar a sus seres queridos lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Hilda, quien se destaca por ser una mujer muy positiva y que se sacrifica por poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Hilda se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender por su barrio.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar cada día.
texts.en: The group called San Isidro is a new group, which is part of the poverty elimination program. Its members are humble women who are fighting to get ahead and provide their loved ones what they weren't able to have themselves. One of the members is Hilda, who stands out for being a positive woman who sacrifices to be able to give her family everything that she wasn't able to have. Hilda's work is preparing meals that she then sells around her neighborhood. She's requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies so that she can prepare the meals, such as vegetables, meats, condiments, produce, and more so that she can continue making her meals. She's thankful for being given the opportunity to improve every day.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to cook food such as: vegetables, meats, condiments, produce and more.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat, 35, is a married mother of two children, one of whom is in school, while the other one is too young to attend school. She is a cassava and rice farmer living in Kampong Cham province, and she has been involved in these businesses for 17 years. Recently, her cassava has not grown well because of drought and insect destruction.

This is the first loan cycle for her group, which consists of two members, with VisionFund. As a group leader, she is willing to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to grow her crop well. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income and improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield and earn more income to keep sending her child to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Verseli

texts.es:
El Sr. Verseli es de Ciudad del Este, es una persona muy trabajadora, que con sacrificio está saliendo adelante, es pintor se dedica a la pintura de viviendas y con esta profesión está ayudando a un familiar que poco a poco fue enseñándole todas la técnicas para realizar un buen trabajo.
 Verseli es una persona muy responsable con sus obligaciones y se siente agradecido por esta oportunidad que recibe.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de herramientas para poder seguir trabajando en su profesión.
texts.en: Verseli is from the city of Este, and is a very hardworking man who's forging ahead through sacrifice. He's a painter whose job is painting homes, and with this job he's helping out a relative who bit by bit taught him all of the techniques for doing the job well. Verseli is a very responsible person with his obligations and he's grateful for this opportunity that he's been given. He's requesting this loan to purchase tools so that he can continue working in this profession.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёре 30 лет. Она родилась в районе Шахринав. У нее среднее образование. Сайёра замужем и мать двоих детей. Ее муж сейчас находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сайёра швея. Она занимается этим более 4 года. Ей очень нравится ее работа. Сайёра шьет с удовольствием. Она приветливая женщина и люди к ней тянутся. У нее много клиентов. Для дальнейшей работы ей нужна современная машина для шитья. Благодаря машине работа пойдет в гору, потому что новая технология работает намного лучше. Поэтому Сайёра просит Вас дать ей кредит значительную сумму для покупки швейной машины. Сайёра верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Sayora is 30 years old. She was born in Shahrinav area. She has secondary education. Sayora is married and has two children. Her husband is now working in Russia. 

Sayora is a seamstress. She has been working in this business for more than four years. She likes her work very much. Sayora sews with pleasure. She is a friendly woman and people reach out to her. She has many clients.
