For further work, she needs a modern sewing machine for sewing. Her work will perk up thanks to a new machine, because new technology works much better. Thus Sayora requests that you loan her a tidy sum for buying a sewing machine. Sayora believes in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Louna

texts.en:
Louna is a 33-year-old, married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children attending school. Her husband is the main income provider in the family to help them to live in good conditions. As for her, she works in a company and works also in parallel as a private teacher.

Today, given that her children will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register them at school. The parents’ only target is to provide them with a good educational path until graduation and help them become able to get good jobs that will give them a good income.

loans.use: to register her children at school

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La Sra. Lourdes es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos mayor y dos menores de edad, a quienes ella mantiene y los está sacando adelante con mucho esfuerzo.
La Sra. Lourdes tiene un inquilinato donde alquila varias piezas y 2 Salones comerciales de esa manera obtiene sus ingresos para la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. 
Pide este préstamo para poder refaccionar su inquilinato y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Lourdes is a single mother of 3 children, one of whom is an adult and the other two are minors. She's supporting them and getting them ahead through lots of effort. Lourdes has a rental property where she rents several units and 2 commercial spaces and in this way she obtains income to pay for her childrens' schooling and food. She's requesting this loan so that she can remodel the rental property and that way continue her job.

loans.use: To remodel a rental property.

loans.name: Miria

texts.en:
Miria is a single mother with two children. She is a resident of Makerere zone in the city outskirts. She is a first time borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance and a responsible woman whose reputation is proved beyond a doubt by neighbours. She owns a small boutique in Kikuubo - Kampala where she goes downtown, selects clothes of her choice at a cheaper price, brings them to her small shop and sells them at a profit. She has operated this shop for nine years and it's through such hard work that she has managed to pay school fees for her two children up to University level.

She has applied for a 1,500,000 UGX loan at UGAFODE Microfinance to expand her business and she is confident that she will perfectly meet her obligations. She is hard working and resilient. Pictured is Miria and the UGAFODE credit staff (right to left) at her shop.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en:
Arkadi is a musician from Stepanavan town. He works at a local art house and also plays during special events (parties, weddings, etc.).

Arkadi doesn't have his own instrument, and he borrows the instrument from the art house. By applying for this loan Arkadi asks lenders to support him to purchase his own accordion.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, the support of lenders is very important for Arkadi to have his own musical instrument, and he hopes for a successful cooperation with Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for a musical instrument (accordion).

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
PATRICK is a resident of Anai in Lira district. He is 45 years old and married with five children.

After failing to find formal employment, he resorted to starting his own business with the small capital he had saved from working as a casual labourer. With advancing age, he felt it was unsafe to keep doing heavy, manual work, and thus resorted to begining his own business(a retail shop) that sells dailiy house hold use items such as sugar,rice, corn flour,soda, bread, scholastic materials among other items.

Recently however, he became short of money because he had paid a lump sum amount for the children's school fees. Thus, he could not afford to buy inventory items for his shop. Yet, his customers want to be served, and this is why he is requesting this loan, as otherwise he may soon lose the customers.

He is appreciative of kiva's support to small enterpreneurs.

loans.use: To boost his retail trade business by stocking MORE COMMODITIES, such as corn and soda, for trade

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a Kiva borrower. She has five children with ages ranging from 12 years to 28 years. She describes herself to be focused.

She operates a retail business where she sells eggs, soap, bread, sugar, milk and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy place, and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

Florence will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, milk, eggs, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a big shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, milk, eggs, flour and other items.

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en: Ephraim  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gaya Village. Ephraim  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Ephraim  suffered from poor yields that crippled hisability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Ephraim  has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 15 bags of maize this year, Ephraim  can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a Babban Gona farmer from Dan'asabe Village. he joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Gabriel no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase him increase his income considerably.  This season Gabriel has ambitious plans to harvest 50 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Gabriel now has the opportunity to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Daura Village. Yakubu joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he  no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to provide healthcare for his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yakubu will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Yakubu has set high goals of harvesting 5 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Yakubu has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a Babban Gona farmer from Waziri Village. she joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Deborah no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to repair her house or move into a bigger home. Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase her increase her income considerably.  This season Deborah has ambitious plans to harvest 20 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Deborah now has the opportunity to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a Babban Gona farmer from Gayya Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase him increase his income considerably.  This season Ibrahim has ambitious plans to harvest 50 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en: Magaji is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maimai Village. Magaji joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Magaji will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help himearn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.  This season, Magaji has grand plans to harvest 40 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Magaji now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 33 ans, Adjoavi est une femme habitant à Tokoin avec son enfant à charge. Adjoavi est une revendeuses des œufs qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché chez les grossistes et les revendent en circulant dans les quartiers environnant pour gagner ses revenus. Pour commander des plateaux d’œufs, Adjoavi nécessite ce fonds pour financer son achat  et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir aider son mari à bien occupé de leur enfant dans son éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Married and 33 years old, Beatrice is a woman living in Tokoin with her dependent child. Beatrice is a reseller of eggs who gets her supplies three times a month at the wholesaler's market and resells them by going around to surrounding neighborhoods in order to increase her income. 

In order to order egg trays, Beatrice needs these funds to pay for her purchase and to make a good profit margin so that she is able to help her husband to provide for their child's school education.

loans.use: to buy 61 egg trays and 4 empty trays.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pegi Village. Ayuba joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ayuba suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ayuba will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ayuba now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm yields.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a Babban Gona farmer from Barau Village. he joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Micah no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to improve my farming skills.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see increase him increase his income considerably. This season Micah has ambitious plans to harvest 30 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Micah now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Peter. He is sixty years old, married and has ten children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and he was able to undergo training on enterprise management and financial management. These training have enhanced productivity in his business since he has enough skills and knowledge on managing the
business.
He does maize and beans farming as his main economic activity. He is borrowing a loan to buy top dressing fertilizers. This will boost the crop yield hence increased income. This will enable him provide his family’s basic needs such as shelter, food, clothing and education for his children.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy top dressing fertilizers. This will boost the crop yield hence increased income.

loans.name: Annick

texts.en:
Annick is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in Rwanda's capital of Kigali with her father, a taxi driver. The first in her family to attend university, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year due to her tremendous academic performance.

Annick plans to major in Health Care Management, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. At school, Annick hopes to improve her public speaking and self-confidence. After graduating, she hopes to contribute by improving the health care system and possibly pursuing a career in counseling.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Marie Solange

texts.fr:
38 ans, mariée, Marie Solange est une mère de famille travailleuse et dynamique. Elle a trois enfants de 6 à 15 ans et qui sont tous scolarisés. 
Les deux époux exercent ensemble et mutuellement l'activité de confection des petits sacs à dos. Elle travaille très dur car la plus part du temps, elle dort peu la nuit pour finir à temps les produits.
Elle a commencé à exploiter cette affaire depuis 2012. Auparavant, elle était couturière salarié dans une petite entreprise individuelle.
Le prêt va être utilisé pour renforcer le matériel de travail, elle va acheter une machine industrielle à l'occasion et quelques matières premières supplémentaires pour la confection des sacs.
Actuellement, la famille habite encore dans une maison appartenant aux parents, et c'est pourquoi, elle voudrait en construire. Elle voudrait offrir une meilleure qualité de vie à ses enfants.
texts.en: Marie Solange is a 38-year-old married mother who is hardworking and energetic. She has 3 children, aged 6-15, all of whom attend school.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine, polyester, white fabrics, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Abakundumurimo Sub Group A

texts.en:
Joseph is a group leader; aged 55 years. She is married with 6 children aged between 10 and 25 years. The group is called ABAKUNDUMURIMO means “the hardworking people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

She sells spare parts and has been running a business for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more spare parts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Compresa Group

texts.en:
Mary is in her late 30s and married with five children. Two of them are in school, and three of them are grown up. She has been selling charcoal for two years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Mary’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the charcoal stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is so grateful for the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought land, loan repayment and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal for resale. She dreams of building her own house.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group Compresa, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Umutuzo Sub Group B

texts.en:
Rehema, 40 years, is married with six children aged between ten and seventeen years. She is also the leader of this group called Umutuzo, which means “believed people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to grow their businesses so as to change their lives for the better.


For the past eight years Rehema is a whole seller of foodstuffs. She has applied for a 4,500,000 RWF loan through Kiva's field partner Urwego to be apportioned among the group members. She will use her share to buy more rice, bananas and cassava to sell. Her profits will be used to pay for medical insurance and school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, bananas and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 19-year-old business lady staying in Guruve district of Zimbabwe, where she operates a clothing shop at the local business center. She started small, but now her business has grown big through the injection of the loan that was put into the business. She sells clothes for men and women.

Apart from the clothing business, she has also ventured into a poultry rearing project, which she intends to expand with the loan that she is now requesting.

At the moment she keeps batches of 100 broiler birds every six weeks but she intends to have batches of 200 birds every week since she has the market for the broilers.

Winnie inspires young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well-being.

Using the proceeds from the first loan, Winnie managed to uplift her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks, feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusines lives with her 2-year-old daughter in Stepanavan town. To sustain her little kid's and her living, Lusine started a retail business a year ago. When the first profit started to appear, Lusine decided to enlarge the variety of goods to sell and gain more customers. She brings the stock from Yerevan town, and besides selling it from her house, she also takes the clothing to nearby villages and sells it there.

Lusine has now applied for this loan to purchase new stock of clothing supplies to meet the current orders of her customers. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, the support of lenders is very important for this hardworking woman to invest in her business and develop it further.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing supplies to meet the current orders of her customers.

loans.name: Istusi

texts.en:
Istusi is a married man who is 28 years of age and lives in a rural area with his family of two children, one of whom attends school. He deals in selling agricultural produce as a business and also does small-scale farming. He started this business in 2010.

He works seven days a week and 13 hours per day, and he acquired this loan to stock more produce. He hopes to expand into a large business that can supply all the people around. His clients are local people from the surrounding places.

The challenges he faces are price fluctuation of some commodities. He describes himself as a trustworthy and hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable is a 24-year-old business lady who lives in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe where she operates a poultry rearing business that she runs from her home place. With the loan that she is requesting, she intends to expand her poultry rearing business from 200 birds every six weeks to rearing 400 birds every six weeks. She intends to purchase more chicks, vaccines and feed using this loan amount.

She inspires young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide, who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well-being. Using the profits from her business so far, she has managed to build a four-room house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks, vaccines and feed.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза 42 летняя женщина. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Сыновьям 20 и 18 лет. Фируза рукодельница.  Фируза профессионал своей работе. Ее доходы только от этой деятельностью. Ей на работе нравится ежедневные доходы, и сшить больше женские и мужские одежды. Фируза решила открыть ателье по шитье и купить новую швейную машинки и другие швейные принадлежности. Для оплаты аренды и купли все необходимые средств ей нудно деньги. С такими планами Фируза обратилась к Вам за кредитом.  Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей  расширить деятельность и привлечь больше клиентов. Путем увеличения клиента увеличиться ежедневный доход.  Фируза верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Firuza is a 42 year old woman. She is married and has two children. Her sons are 20 and 18 years old. Firuza is a seamstress. Firuza is a professional in her work. Her income is only from this business. She likes the daily income from her work, and sewing more women's and men's clothes. 

Firuza decided to open a workshop for sewing and to buy a new sewing machine and other sewing supplies. To pay the rent and buy all the necessary resources, she needs money. With this plan, Firuza has turned to you for a loan. 

The requested loan will help her to expand her business and attract more clients. By increasing her clients, her daily income will increase too. Firuza believes in you and your support.

loans.use: to get a new workshop for sewing, and to obtain sewing supplies.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells tomatoes and other vegetables. His business is located in a market  and his primary customers are loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price changes. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and other vegetables. This is his fifth  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 57 years old and married, and she supports 4 children.

She has been practicing tree planting for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 13,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her trees. This is in order to meet her increasing clients' demands in the market, as well as the needs of her family.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan, and the surplus to buy a dairy cow for milk production.

Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her trees in order to meet her increasing clients' demands in the market, and the needs of her family.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a construction specialist from Vanadzor town. He lives with his parents, wife and three-year-old son. He works as a construction and repair specialist and receives different orders working in houses. He has now applied for this loan to purchase materials and tools needed for current work.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, the support of lenders is very important for Armen and his work to complete it successfully and earn income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for materials and tools needed to provide repair and construction services.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Koeun, 51, is a married woman from Kampong Thom province. She has five children.

To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing vegetables for sale. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is able to make an income of USD 2.50 per day, on average.

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide suitable living conditions for the household. Due to her lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation.

She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation.

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie is already 55 years old. She is a college undergraduate who happens to have had a hard time looking for a stable job. For this reason, while waiting for a professional opportunity to arise, she has been running a sari-sari store business which she started five years ago in Batasan, Quezon City. Here she sells different products and grocery items which satisfy her customers' demands for various commodities. With this trade, she earns a living which is enough to support the daily needs of her family.

However, she doesn’t want to settle in the kind of life they have right now. She has a dream of being successful someday. That is why, with all possible means, she is working hard to achieve her aspirations. In fact, she already took out a loan from Kiva previously, to further and enhance her business trade.

Now she is coming to you again for a similar cause. She wants to take out a loan of PHP 30,000 that she will utilize to buy additional goods to sell in her sari-sari store. Assuring you that she will improve her business with this loan, she is truly hoping that you can help her towards the bright future ahead of her and of her family.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as being ambitious. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years, and her primary customers are locals.

Bernadette describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Fitriyah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Fitriyah. Fitriyah is 33 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her two sons. Fitriyah has been selling meatballs for eight years, and her husband has been a public transportation driver for 15 years. She and her husband pull together to increase their family income.

Fitriyah has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 7,200,000 IDR. This loan will be used to buy and build a sanitation unit at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to a safe sanitation and water source. Her family's income is still not enough to build a toilet and water source with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a sanitation unit at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Ma. Erna

texts.en:
Ma. Erna is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Erna dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops and to buy vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey, 44, is a farmer living in a wooden house in Kampong Thom province. She is a married mother of four children; one of her children is now in school and needs better support for studying.

To support her family’s needs, Rey has been growing rice for several years to earn her main income. Selling medicine has been practiced to earn extra income. These days, the crop is in danger because of drought. Now, she is applying for a loan; this is not the first time for her, as she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for a cycle already. The previous loan has enabled her to earn good income to support her living conditions and be able to send her child to school. This time, she will use her loan to pay for her child's school fees. She hopes that her child will get a higher education and find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fees so that her child will be able to get a higher education and find a good job.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Ma. Bella has been able to run her mini food stall without worrying about how to get supplementary capital to run her business. For this, she wants to thank Kiva and lenders all around the world. She’s an entrepreneur who is able to get support from lenders and she’s thankful to them for considering her previous story and offering monetary support.

The previous loan was used to buy ingredients for her mini food stall business. Ma. Bella wants to upgrade it to an eatery business or “carinderia” in Tagalog. That’s why she applied for another loan of PHP 15,000 this year to buy necessities for the business like a sack of rice, groceries, meat, and vegetables. She is hoping that her request will be considered by the Center for Community Transformation (CCT).

Despite being busy managing the business, Ma. Bella spends spare time attending a CCT group fellowship that consists of 10-15 individuals, where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners, studies the word of God, builds social relationships with other partners, and pays microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed for her business.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Это Гулчехра. Ей всего 26 лет. Она проживает на районе Вахш. Гулчехра добрая и ответственная женщина. Она развелась с мужем и с одним ребенком вернулась в родительский дом. Гулчехра не потеряла уверенности в себя, и продолжила жить.  Гулчехра занялась шитьем женской одежды. Ей удобно, шить на дому, она параллельно ведет домашнее хозяйство. Гулчехра от дохода своей деятельностью копила денег, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Сейчас ей не хватает денежных средств, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Из-за нехватки денег она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить стройматериалы для ремонта. Это кредит поможет Гулчехре достичь свою цель. Гулчехра верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This is Gulchehra. She is only 26 years old. She lives in the Vakhsh area. Gulchehra is a kind and responsible woman. She divorced her husband and returned to her parents' home with her child. Gulchehra did not lose confidence in herself, and has continued to live. Gulchehra sews women's clothes. It is convenient for her to sew at home, and she keeps house at the same time. 

Gulchehra has been saving money from her business income in order to renovate her home. Now she does not have enough funds to renovate her home. Because of her insufficient money, she has applied for a loan in order to buy building materials for renovations. This loan will help Gulchehra to reach her goal. Gulchehra believes in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a display case, a few boxes of soap, different pastas and dried fish

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Maria Auxiliadora, está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ilda, quien a través de su esfuerzo y sacrificio está luchando para poder salir adelante.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas varias, hace ricas comidas y es muy buena en lo que hace, y ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella los productos que viene haciendo.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ayudar a su familia, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, pollo, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is named Maria Auxiliadora and it is part of a poverty elimination program. One of the members is Ilda who, through her efforts and sacrifice, is fighting to get ahead. Ilda works selling a variety of food. She makes rich meals and is very good at what she does. Currently, she has a good clientele that always buys the products she makes from her.

She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to help her family. She is seeking this loan to purchase vegetables, meat, chicken, condiments and other items so she will be able to continue with her work like she has done before.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, chicken, condiments and other items to make meals.

loans.name: Koko Brigitte

texts.fr: Divorcée et  mère de deux enfants, Koko est une femme âgée de 51 ans qui vit à Baguida. Koko est une couturière qui confectionne des habits dans son atelier de couture sise à son domicile et les revendent au marché. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire pour la confection, Koko se rend deux fois par mois au marché. Koko demande ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes en vue de gagner un gain et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Koko is a 51-year-old divorced mother to two children who lives in Baguida. Koko is a seamstress who creates clothing in her home workshop. She then sells her creations at market. In order to get the supplies she needs to do her work, Koko goes to market two times per month. Koko is requesting this loan in order to purchase sheets of pagne cloth. By doing this, she will be able to earn a profit which will allow her to meet her children's needs.

loans.use: to purchase five sheets of traditional pagne cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes and trainers
